title: Maxar partners with Array Labs to expand 3D imaging technology
summary:
Array Labs, based in Palo Alto, California, is developing a 3D radar imaging constellation designed to operate in clusters
The post Maxar partners with Array Labs to expand 3D imaging technology appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Call with Sławosz Uznański-Wiśniewski at Paris Air Show 2025
summary: Watch the replay of the call between Josef Aschbacher, ESA Director General, Andrius Kubilius, EU Commissioner for Defence and Space, and Sławosz Uznański-Wiśniewski, ESA project astronaut. This call took place at the Paris Air Show 2025 (Le Bourget) on 18 June. Project astronaut Uznański-Wiśniewski joined from quarantine ahead of the upcoming Ignis mission mission.

title: Venturi Space announces European lunar rover design
summary:
Venturi Space, a company working with Astrolab on lunar rover concepts, unveiled an all-European rover design it hopes to offer to European space agencies.
The post Venturi Space announces European lunar rover design appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch 28 Starlink satellites on Falcon 9 rocket from Cape Canaveral
summary: The Starlink 10-18 mission will be SpaceX’s 75th Falcon 9 launch of 2025. It’s targeting liftoff from pad 40 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station at 1:55 a.m. EDT (0555 UTC).

title: July decision expected on combination of European space companies
summary:
Three European aerospace companies expect to decide by next month whether to combine their space divisions, something that could still take years to win regulatory approvals.
The post July decision expected on combination of European space companies appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Career Exploration: Using Ingenuity and Innovation to Create ‘Memory Metals’
summary: Othmane Benafan is a NASA engineer whose work is literally reshaping how we use aerospace materials — he creates metals that can shape shift. Benafan, a materials research engineer at NASA’s Glenn Research Center in Cleveland, creates metals called shape memory alloys that are custom-made to solve some of the most pressing challenges of space […]

title: NASA Welcomes Community, Astronauts to Marshall’s 65th Anniversary Celebration July 19
summary: NASA’s Marshall Space Flight Center invites the community to help celebrate the center’s 65th anniversary during a free public event noon to 5 p.m. CDT Saturday, July 19, at The Orion Amphitheater in Huntsville, Alabama. Marshall, along with its partners and collaborators, will fill the amphitheater with space exhibits, music, food vendors, and hands-on activities […]

title: CEOs push back on proposed cuts to commercial satellite imaging programs
summary:
The Trump administration’s proposal would cut electro-optical imagery funding and eliminate funding entirely for the acquisition of synthetic aperture radar (SAR) imagery

title: From Space to Soil: How NASA Sees Forests
summary: NASA uses satellite lidar technology to study Earth’s forests, key carbon sinks.

title: NASA Engineers Simulate Lunar Lighting for Artemis III Moon Landing
summary: Better understanding the lunar lighting environment will help NASA prepare astronauts for the harsh environment Artemis III Moonwalkers will experience on their mission. NASA’s Artemis III mission will build on earlier test flights and add new capabilities with the human landing system and advanced spacesuits to send the first astronauts to explore the lunar South […]
